DataElement.preferredName: Zubrod Performance Status Clinical Trial Protocol Defined Study Subject Fulfill Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A Yes/No indicator that indicates if the participant met protocol defined eligibility criteria corresponding to Zubrod Performance status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Zubrod Performance Status Clinical Trial Protocol Defined Study Subject Fulfill
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scale used to assess how a patient's disease is progressing and assess how the disease affects the daily living abilities of the patient.:A document that describes the objective(s), design, methodology, statistical considerations, and organization of a trial. The protocol usually also gives the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be provided in other protocol referenced documents. Throughout the ICH GCP Guideline the term protocol refers to protocol and protocol amendments. NOTE: Present usage can refer to any of three distinct entities: 1) the plan (i.e., content) of a protocol, 2) the protocol document, and 3) a series of tests or treatments (as in oncology). [ICH E6 Glossary]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A scale used to assess how a patient's disease is progressing and assess how the disease affects the daily living abilities of the patient.

Concepts.definition: A scale used to assess how a patient's disease is progressing and assess how the disease affects the daily living abilities of the patient.

The protocol usually also gives the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be provided in other protocol referenced documents. Throughout the ICH GCP Guideline the term protocol refers to protocol and protocol amendments. NOTE: Present usage can refer to any of three distinct entities: 1) the plan (i.e., content) of a protocol, 2) the protocol document, and 3) a series of tests or treatments (as in oncology). [ICH E6 Glossary]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

Concepts.definition: A document that describes the objective(s), design, methodology, statistical considerations, and organization of a trial. The protocol usually also gives the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be provided in other protocol referenced documents. Throughout the ICH GCP Guideline the term protocol refers to protocol and protocol amendments. NOTE: Present usage can refer to any of three distinct entities: 1) the plan (i.e., content) of a protocol, 2) the protocol document, and 3) a series of tests or treatments (as in oncology). [ICH E6 Glossary]
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
